content: my cosy c2c shawl by suzy daisy boo creations this is my writwhat does c2c mean the pattern c2c means corner to corner and this 1 chain 6 stitch is generally used to make a square or a rectangle this is not one of my patterns there are many many tutorials online that will explain how to do this however i thought i would show you how i do mine so this pattern will show you how to initially start off and increase our row there is no decreasing on this pattern so i ve not included details on that i m also going to show you how to 2 treble double crochet into the fourth change colours with c2c crochet chain from the hook here is a step by step photo tutorial of the c2c this pattern is written in u k terms with u s terms written along side in brackets materials you will need a crochet hook - i used a 3mm hook on mine however use whichever hook you want depending on 3 treble double crochet into the next the yarn you are using two chains yarn - i used 4 ply yarn scraps from various past designs this are generally all handdyed merino sock yarn scissors a sewing needle sorry there s lots of ends to sew in i always leave this bit until 4 chain 6 last i curl up with a mug of hot chocolate and netflix and sew them in are you ready let s start 5 treble double crochet into the fourth 9 treble double crochet three times in the chain from the hook and in the post of the turning chain if you are following two chains wanting to continue in the same colour just keep repeating row 4 through to 9 6 now this is where we flip our bottom section over take a look at the if you would like to change colour as i did photograph then don t finish your last treble double crochet cut your yarn with around 5 inches to spare to sew in and pull your new colour in and complete the stitch then you continue in the pattern from row 4 through to 9 i ve added a few photos below so you can see how the next few row work up 7 slip_stitch into the chain 3 chain on the previous row 8 chain 3 if you have any problems please pop me a message on ig or at www daisyboo net happy hooking suzy
